parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The feast of Passover, the Passover lamb. Of Chaldee origin; the Passover.
